title: Is there a common underlying link in people who are most seriously affected by Covid 19? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don't know an awful lot but because Covid-19 is a virus that has never infected humans before, anyone who does not have a strong enough immune system to fight the virus is at more risk. Anybody elderly, terminally ill or in poor health, has a lower rate of overcoming the virus. People who are on long-term medication - depending on the medication being taken - smokers (because the predominant chest infection) heavy drinkers, or anyone on a prolonged poor diet, or unhealthy lifestyle, may be more at risk of more severe symptoms or delayed recovery. As with most illnesses, stress never helps either.

The statistics showed the following people to become critical cases or to have more severe symptoms and difficulty fighting the pneumonia phase of COVID-19: persons over age 54history of heart diseasehistory of diabetesimmunocompromised or on immunosuppressant drugsBasically, anyone who is less capable of quickly healing lung/respiratory/alveolar tissue - as that is what gets attacked by the virus and is damaged to yield the worst symptoms.
